TopicTitle: Normal maps don't work when NOT converting textures in part tools

Articles.Content: I would like to leave textures unconverted when saving my parts in part tools. I left the convert texture tickbox unselected. This is what I got: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/2988574/screenshot1.png. If I convert the texture it works fine. Any ideas how to fix this?

I'm too not quite happy with conversion PartTools applies .

But, it seems that in order to leave textures unconverted, one should re-write PartTools a bit (as the sources are included)... I just did not succeed in doing that (and, uh, I wonder does EULA allow it? ).
Leaving textures unconverted is pretty essential for editable skins so I hope there is a fix. I tried inverting colors channels and adding alpha channel to the normal map but no luck..

Leaving textures unconverted is pretty essential for editable skins so I hope there is a fix. I tried inverting colors channels and adding alpha channel to the normal map but no luck..
As far as I understand, KSP just cannot tell the texture is to be used as "normal map" if it's not converted, and interprets it as a "simple texture".

Try to change "texture type" to "texture" in Unity Editor import settings; you'll get similar result

So... fiddling with texture itself won't help

Yes, you want to convert them because thats how the system works.

Also it looks like that unity doesn't see that map as a normal... you sure that unity identify the map as a normal one?
